body.p:
To
His Excellency the Governor of Kentucky. Your petitioner would respectfully State the following facts to you hoping that after a due consideration of the premises. You may be induced to lend him a helping hand by the power that is invested in you as Goveror of Said State,

Samuel H. Richardson States that at the May Term of the Metcalf equity & criminal Court there was a Judgement of Said Court rendered against Said Richardson for retailing Spiritous liquors without licence and a fine of $2000 assessed against him. he States that Said Judgement was rendered against him in his absence. He having been mistaken in the Term of Said Court. that If he had been at Said Court with his witnesses that he would have been ampply able to have proven his innocence. that he had no opportunity of cross Examening the witnesses against him that the whole proceedings were Commenced and Carried through to a Judgement by some malicious enemies of his. wherefore he prays that you remit Said fine with the Costs there on.

I John Y Wallace
Judge of the Metcalf County Court and well acquainted with Samuel H Richardson and knowing the facts Contained in the above petition to be true would respectfully Solicit your excellency to remit Said fine and Cost as an act of Justice to an honorable man and law abideing Citizen
Given under my hand this 20th day of August 1863
John Y Wallace J M C C

Metcalfe Eq Ct
$20 } Liquor
Fine remitted
J F Robinson
Saml H. Richardson
Issd Aug 27 1863
